title: London travel chaos as Jubilee line part suspended
text:
Large crowds of people were seen queuing at London Waterloo and Bakerloo after the Jubilee line was suspended (Picture: Twitter)

London tube commuters faced major rush-hour delays this morning after a large part of the Jubilee line was suspended.

Transport for London (TfL) said the suspension has been caused by an ‘unavailability of trains’ after a number of faulty ones were removed from service.

Images have shown large crowds of people queuing in the tunnels to and from platforms at London Waterloo and at Bakerloo station.

There is currently no service between Neasden and Waterloo with severe delays across the network.

A reduced service is set to run until this afternoon, according to TfL.

Commuters on the Bakerloo Line platform at Waterloo after the Jubilee line suspension (Picture: Twitter)

Frustrated London tube commuters have taken to Twitter to complain about the delays.

One wrote: ‘Absolutely disgraceful still stuck at Stratford awaiting a jubilee service.

‘Shortage of trains? Seriously, what the actual hell kind of appalling service is this?

”Late4 work, third time in a week.’

Another wrote: ‘The service has been appalling this week. Long waits and consistently delayed.’

There was huge crowds forming in the tunnels to and from the platform at Waterloo station (Picture: Twitter)

It emerged the train were removed from service after faults were discovered during a routine safety inspection on Thursday.

TfL said tickets will be accepted on c2c services between Upminster and Fenchurch Street, London Buses, DLR, London Overground, TFL Rail, Southeastern and Thameslink via any reasonable route.

Extinction Rebellion protesters targeted several London tube yesterday, including Shadwell DLR where activists glued themselves to the top and side of a train.

At Canning Town, an angry mob of commuters dragged two Extinction Rebellion protesters from the top of a train as the demonstration held up services.

One of the protesters appeared to be attacked after being pulled down on the platform.

British Transport Police confirmed they have charged eight protesters with obstructing the railway following the protests at Canning Town, Stratford and Shadwell DLR.

description: A large part of the Jubilee line has been suspended less than 24 hours after Extinction Rebellion protests caused havoc on the London Underground.
